title: Oscar Castellino
shortBiography: Oscar Castellino is an international baritone and composer of Mars Anthem "Rise to Mars". He was born in a car on a busy street in Mumbai and traces his roots to Goa. Earlier a software engineer, he was scouted for his operatic talent by Patricia Rozario on her concert tour of India.

upcomingEvents.event: Oscar Castellino | Voz de Ópera de Goa
upcomingEvents.information: An evening where the grandeur of opera intertwines with the soul of Goa. Beloved operatic arias meet traditional Konkani and Goan-Portuguese songs.
upcomingEvents.description: Join acclaimed baritone Oscar Castellino for an evening where the grandeur of opera intertwines with the soul of Goa. This unique concert weaves together beloved operatic arias with traditional Konkani and Goan-Portuguese songs, creating a musical bridge between two cultures bound by history. From the stages of the Royal Opera House to the shores of the Arabian Sea, experience a voice that carries the lyric traditions of Europe and the heart of Goa.

upcomingEvents.information: A Christmas celebration featuring Konkani and Goan-Portuguese carols, reviving old traditions. Details to be announced.
upcomingEvents.description: Following the huge success of Concerto de Natal 2025, Oscar Castellino returns to Goa for Christmas 2026 with another enchanting evening of Konkani and Goan-Portuguese carols. Stay tuned for more details.

upcomingEvents.event: DEC 14 Oscar Castellino and the Time Makers - A Goan Christmas Experience, Museum of Goa - Goa, India

upcomingEvents.information: Following the grand success of Goan Interactions 2025, the Baluji Music Foundation in collaboration with Melville Rodrigues and Oscar Castellino present an enchanting evening of timeless Goan Konkani and Portuguese tunes.

upcomingEvents.description: Following the grand success of Goan Interactions 2025, the Baluji Music Foundation in collaboration with Melville Rodrigues and Oscar Castellino bring to you an enchanting evening of timeless Goan Konkani and Portuguese tunes, featuring baritone Oscar Castellino, sitar maestro Baluji Shrivastav OBE, vocalist Chelsea D'Silva, pianist Mark Troop and tabla maestro Yusuf Ali Khan. Celebrate Goa's unique European-Indian musical tapestry in a countryside-like London setting. Goan snacks available.
upcomingEvents.contactInfo: Goan snacks available. For enquiries contact voice@oscarcastellino.com

upcomingEvents.information: Konkani, Portuguese and Latin Carols. Goan Welfare Society and Baluji Music Foundation join hands to usher in the Christmas Spirit. Gorgeous music in a traditional Goan Style. Tickets include plate of snacks

upcomingEvents.information: Welcome to the Rogue-Style workshop with a focus on Bachata
upcomingEvents.time:
7 pm to 9 pm
Wednesday January 14, 2026
We may take a few moments to set up and we will have a 10 minute break in between.
upcomingEvents.venue: Our Lady of Hal R C Church
upcomingEvents.address:
165 Arlington Rd, London NW1 7EX
near Camden Town tube station
upcomingEvents.description:
About the Instructor.

Oscar Castellino is a performer with the Royal Ballet and Opera as an opera singer. Oscar has 20 years experience in salsa and bachata. Oscar’s Rogue style of dance evolved over the years bringing his experience on stage at the highest level as an actor-singer onto the dance floor. He developed a style that combines the best of both worlds into the Rogue style.

This particular workshop is titled Rogue Resonance

Message from Oscar:

Resonance is something second nature to a singer. The singer uses their surroundings to enhance their sound. It's no different with a dancer - the music, their partner, the temperature, their mood, the lighting and the overall atmosphere must be a part of the dance they create.

This workshop will take whatever skill level you have as a dancer and enhance it with better awareness of the concepts of Rogue Resonance. We will have 6 to 10 people to keep it effective.

I advise easy clothing and shoes. We will work at a lovely church hall in Camden so we would prefer shoes that do not mark the wooden flooring. There will be a kitchenette with a kettle and I will bring along tea and coffee.

Darryl will be taking some bits of footage that we can use for further promotion so please let me know if you do not wish to be included in the footage.
upcomingEvents.contactInfo: email voice@oscarcastellino.com for participation request and registration details, we suggest a voluntary contribution £10 towards expenses.

The concert at 5 pm will feature blind guitarist Luis Mosquera showcasing a new piece by Zahra Palmer and she will perform it.
This will be followed by a classical section with Baritone Oscar Castellino, Soprano Daniella Sicari and Pianist Gavin Roberts.
